sub_topic: Finding the determinant of a matrix
message_1:
Find the determinant of the following 2x2 matrix:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
3 & 5 \\
-2 & 4
\end{bmatrix}
$$
message_2:
To find the determinant of a 2x2 matrix, we use the formula:

$$
\text{det}(A) = ad - bc
$$

where a, b, c, and d are the elements of the matrix:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
a & b \\
c & d
\end{bmatrix}
$$

In this case, the matrix is:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
3 & 5 \\
-2 & 4
\end{bmatrix}
$$

So, a = 3, b = 5, c = -2, and d = 4. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

$$
\text{det}(A) = (3)(4) - (5)(-2) = 12 + 10 = 22
$$

The determinant of the given matrix is 22.
